title: ISic003292. Fragment of an Epitaph
body:
Facsimile Images

Ἐν[θάδε κῖτε]
Σα[---]
ζή[σας? ἔτη ---]
[---]

Apparatus criticus

Text based on photograph; ζήσας or ζήσασα depending on the gender of the deceased

English translation

Here lies Sa-, having lived for … years …

Italian translation

Qui giace Sa-, avendo vissuto per … anni …

commentary

The fragmentary epitaph presents the structure with the formula ἐνθάδε κεῖται (or κῖτε, as frequent in the Sicilian epigraphy), followed by the name of the deceased (Σα[---]) and the age (introduced by the participle of ζάω): in this case is not possible to determine the gender of the deceased and thus the form of the participle.

bibliography

    54.0911 https://biblio.inscriptiones.org/epig10000796 195 https://biblio.inscriptiones.org/epig10000028
